snippet: The decision by a 5-year-old’s parents to take him to the Czech Republic for treatment of a brain tumor has thrown a harsh light on Britain’s National Health Service.
abstract: Denial of cancer treatment to 5-year-old Ashya King, who is suffering from a brain tumor, and poor handling of the case prompts public outcry over Britain's National Health Service; critics say country's health service is reluctant to support cutting-edge treatment.
lead_paragraph: The decision by a 5-year-old’s parents to take him to the Czech Republic for treatment of a brain tumor has thrown a harsh light on Britain’s National Health Service.

headline.main: Health Care for Britain in Harsh Light
headline.print_headline: Health Care for Britain in Harsh Light
